body.p:
Paris April 28th 1862
To His Excellency
The Governor of Ky
Dear sir:

When I was attorney for the Commonwealth many years ago a negro man named Jourdan was convicted ^in The Scott Court^ for killing a slave belonging to Mr Offutt I believe, It has been so long ago that I cannot remember the proof accurately, but I have a general recollection that the prisoner proved a good general character upon the trial and that there were many mitigating facts proven in -- his defence. And I learn that the judge who presided at the trial and the jury have petitioned for his pardon upon certain terms.
I cheerfully join in the petition for his pardon --
